intro: Meehania urticifolia, commonly known as the stinging nettle plant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves that can cause skin irritation. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has small, yellowish-green flowers. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Meehania urticifolia plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
